text: whether mortgagee's costs of defending suit to set aside mortgage were a contingent liability of the mortgagor secured by the mortgage
whether mortgagor obliged to provide security for contingent liability in order to obtain discharge.
consideration of a separate question of the basis upon which an order for costs might be made on the application of the third respondent

consideration of whether the costs of the proceedings incurred by the third respondent fall within the notion of "enforcement expenses" for the purposes of clause 20 of the mortgage entered into between the first respondent and the third respondent

consideration of the principles to be applied in determining the basis upon which a mortgagee ought to have its costs as against the mortgagor of the proceedings having regard to the terms of the mortgage itself

consideration of whether particular arrangements for the transfer of trust property and the ultimate transfer of that trust property constitute transactions rendered voidable by operation of s 588fe of the corporations act 2001 (cth) and whether the transfer of the property is rendered void by operation of s 468 of the act  family law
the interaction between s 90ac of the family law act 1975 (cth) and ss 588fa , 588fb and 588fda of the corporations act 2001 (cth)  evidence
whether the court should exercise its discretion under s 30ai of the federal court of australia act 1976 (cth) to receive further evidence on appeal
